revised_title: Influence of Moon on Atmospheric Pressure at St. Helena Observatory
tldr: The author analyzes barometer observations at the Magnetic Observatory in St. Helena to determine the influence of the moon on atmospheric pressure. The study reveals that the moon's passage over both the inferior and superior meridian produces a slight increase in pressure, with a maximum curve at both points. The pressure is also found to be greater around new moon than full moon and greater in the third and fourth quarters than the first and second quarters.
